creator: pb@mhs.ch

text: *** Bug 28088 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: trawick@apache.org
wrowe@apache.org
text:
I'm willing to blame mod_isapi, not mod_include, for the moment.  Will do
  some experimenting, perhaps add an isapi module in the perl-framework to
  reproduce.

  This sounds possibly like mod_isapi's response is percolating to r->main.

This bug was resolved by r416272 which was committed to trunk a few hours ago.

The problem is that mod_isapi is returning a status of 500 instead of whatever
was intended (200) and mod_include is puking on it. r416272 changes the logic
used by mod_isapi to return the status so that it matches what was really
intended by the ISAPI developer.
creator: matt@iamcode.net

text:
Will Rowe has posted a zipfile containing compiled mod_isapi modules which
include the patch correcting this bug (for use with 2.0.58 and 2.2.2), for
testing purposes. It is available at:

http://people.apache.org/~wrowe/mod_isapi-416293.zip

You may read his full email to the dev@httpd.apache.org list here:

http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=apache-httpd-dev&m=115206683718140&w=2

If you test this version of mod_isapi, please post your feedback to the
dev@httpd.apache.org list. Your feedback will help ensure that there are no
regressions or other issues in this version of mod_isapi.
creator: matt@iamcode.net
